page.title: 10Dentons Farm visit
page.content: Willow farm, known locally as Dentons, is near the centre of the village in East st.The Denton family have owned the land for over 60 years and run it almost entirely alone.The flat land but variety of soils has little influence on the type of farming but the further away from the river the more productive the fields.The farmstead is peripheral,lying to the north of the fields,but the holding is compact around a central area.Some of the old buildings have changed their use.One of the buildings we visited used to be a cart shed and is now a pig breeding unit and hoppers are replacing the need to store fodder. the farming enterprise varis from livestock,cereals,roots and fodder crops, using as much available space as possible because as Mr Bowers our guide put it "space is money".
